titles.title: Christ on the Mount of Olives

historicEventInformations.remarks: [scheint datiert zu sein nah dem Junger unten rechts, cda 2018]

pageContext.description:
This unique sheet belongs to the earliest known group of prints by Cranach. [...] It depicts the beginning of Christ's passion. Kneeling, with his arms outstretched and his mouth wide open Christ begs his father to let the chalice pass him. This symbol of his forthcoming passion is held by an angel. [...] The contrast between his inner tension and the three apostles sleeping peacefully in the foreground could not be greater. 
[Exhib. Cat. Düsseldorf 2017, 108, No. 4]
